definition: to make more youthful/to promote younger staff
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth

sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年轻人表示，由于睡眠不足而没劲儿运动。

sentences.english: When a young man reached 18 or 20 years old, the capping ceremony would be held.
sentences.chinese: 一个年轻的男人十八岁或二十岁时，要举行冠礼。

sentences.english: The new premier is forming his government mainly from young men.
sentences.chinese: 这位新总理主要从年轻人中物色人选组建政府。

sentences.english: I made a vow to writing, very young.
sentences.chinese: 我立誓写作时非常年轻。

sentences.english: We ask the young Uighur restaurant worker how it should be stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我们问餐厅年轻的维吾尔员工这样冤冤相报何时能了。

sentences.english: Entirely devoted to the Party, the young soldier gave his life for his country.
sentences.chinese: 对党无限忠诚，这位年轻的士兵为祖国献出了生命。

sentences.english: I asked the strange boy, raising my eyebrows in curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 我好奇地扬起眉毛问这个奇怪的年轻人。

sentences.english: They have retrained a number of young technicians for our factory.
sentences.chinese: 他们为我厂再培训了一些年轻的技术员。

sentences.english: The young boxer has copped the prize of the first round.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的拳击手已获得了第一回合的胜利。

sentences.english: EVERY evening the young Fisherman went out upon the sea, and threw his nets into the water.
sentences.chinese: 每晚，年轻的渔夫都要出海打鱼，将他的网撒进水里。

sentences.english: This year we had twenty-seven young women enter.
sentences.chinese: 今年我们有27名年轻女性新加入。

sentences.english: My biological mother was a young unwed college graduate student and she decided to put me up for adoption.
sentences.chinese: 我的亲生母亲是一个年轻的没有结汇棠大学毕业生。

sentences.english: They began to eam their living when they were very young.
sentences.chinese: 他们很年轻的时候，就开始谋生了。

sentences.english: Nothing was heard in the room but the hurrying pen of the stripling.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里悄然无声，只有年轻人的笔匆忙划过纸页。

sentences.english: But I will no longer importune my young cousin.
sentences.chinese: 可是我也不愿意委曲我那年轻的表妹。

sentences.english: A young policeman has been accused of conspiring with a gang of criminals.
sentences.chinese: 一名年轻警察被指控与一个犯罪集团相勾结。

definition: Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
newcomer/fresh talent/newlywed, esp. new bride/bride and groom
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
peer/one's contemporary/person of the same age
